ch.ecma.csta.voiceunit

Class VoiceUnitAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.ecma.csta.voiceunit.VoiceUnitAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VoiceUnitListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class VoiceUnitAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements VoiceUnitListener
    Implements a "do nothing" callback method for each voice unit event type. To learn more about how to use a listener adapter, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $
    Author:
    Avaya Inc.

    • Method Detail

      • playSuspended

        public void playSuspended(SuspendPlayEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: VoiceUnitListener
        A callback function which is automatically invoked when the SuspendPlayEvent occurs on the voice unit and this listener has been added to a device's voice unit. The SuspendPlayEvent indicates that a message is suspended in play. See the SuspendPlayEvent for more information.

        The connection parameter that specifies the device where the message is being suspended is of type ConnectionID so extracting the device ID is a three-step process: 

                        ConnectionID    connID = event.getConnection();
                LocalDeviceID localDeviceID = connID.getDeviceID();
                DeviceID deviceID = localDeviceID.getStaticID();
        Specified by:
        playSuspended in interface VoiceUnitListener
        Parameters:
        event - provides data about the message whose play operation has been suspended.

      • playing

        public void playing(PlayEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: VoiceUnitListener
        A callback function which is automatically invoked when the PlayEvent occurs on the voice unit and this listener has been added to a device's voice unit. The PlayEvent indicates that a message is being played. See the PlayEvent for more information.

        The connection parameter that specifies the device where the message is being playied is of type ConnectionID so extracting the device ID is a three-step process: 

                        ConnectionID    connID = event.getConnection();
                LocalDeviceID localDeviceID = connID.getDeviceID();
                DeviceID deviceID = localDeviceID.getStaticID();

        Specified by:
        playing in interface VoiceUnitListener
        Parameters:
        event - provides the file name(s) of the message(s) being played and the device to which it is being played

      • recordSuspended

        public void recordSuspended(SuspendRecordEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: VoiceUnitListener
        A callback function which is automatically invoked when the SuspendRecordEvent occurs on the voice unit and this listener has been added to a device's voice unit. The SuspendRecordEvent indicates that a message is suspended during recording. See the SuspendRecordEvent for more information.

        The connection parameter that specifies the device where the message is being suspended is of type ConnectionID so extracting the device ID is a three-step process: 

                        ConnectionID    connID = event.getConnection();
                LocalDeviceID localDeviceID = connID.getDeviceID();
                DeviceID deviceID = localDeviceID.getStaticID();

        Specified by:
        recordSuspended in interface VoiceUnitListener
        Parameters:
        event - provides data about the message whose record operation has been suspended.

      • recording

        public void recording(RecordEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: VoiceUnitListener
        A callback function which is automatically invoked when the RecordEvent occurs on the voice unit and this listener has been added to a device's voice unit. The RecordEvent indicates that a message is being recorded. See the RecordEvent for more information.

        The connection parameter that specifies the device where the message is being playied is of type ConnectionID so extracting the device ID is a three-step process: 

                        ConnectionID    connID = event.getConnection();
                LocalDeviceID localDeviceID = connID.getDeviceID();
                DeviceID deviceID = localDeviceID.getStaticID();

        Specified by:
        recording in interface VoiceUnitListener
        Parameters:
        event - provides filename of the message being recorded and the device to which the message is being delivered

        Not implemented.
        Specified by:
        reviewing in interface VoiceUnitListener

      • stopped

        public void stopped(StopEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: VoiceUnitListener
        A callback function which is automatically invoked when the StopEvent occurs on the voice unit and this listener has been added to a device's voice unit. The StopEvent indicates that a play or record operation for a message on a device has been stopped.

        When calling recordMessage and stop multiple times, a StopEvent from an earlier stop may occur after subsequent calls to recordMessage. This means a StopEvent may be associated with an earlier recordMessage rather than the most recent recordMessage.

        See the StopEvent for more information.

        The connection parameter that specifies the device where the message is being playied is of type ConnectionID so extracting the device ID is a three-step process: 

                        ConnectionID    connID = event.getConnection();
                LocalDeviceID localDeviceID = connID.getDeviceID();
                DeviceID deviceID = localDeviceID.getStaticID();

        Example code to extract private data from the event: 

         Object privateDataObject = request.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData();
 if(privateDataObject instanceof PlayMessagePrivateData){
   String msg = ((PlayMessagePrivateData)privateDataObject).getPlayMessage();
         String[] msgs = ((PlayMessagePrivateData)privateDataObject).getFileList();
 }
 else if(privateDataObject instanceof RecordMessagePrivateData){
   String filename = ((RecordMessagePrivateData)privateDataObject).getFilename();
   String timestamp = ((RecordMessagePrivateData)privateDataObject).getTimestamp();
 }
        Specified by:
        stopped in interface VoiceUnitListener
        Parameters:
        event - provides data about the message whose play or record operation has been stopped.

      • voiceAttributeChanged

        public void voiceAttributeChanged(VoiceAttributeChangedEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: VoiceUnitListener
        Not implemented.
        Specified by:
        voiceAttributeChanged in interface VoiceUnitListener
